citeinfo.title: Data Recordings from the Ivanpah Solar Electric Generating System (ISEGS) Facility Recorded by the USGS during Spring and Fall 2014
citeinfo.geoform: Video files, static image files, tabular data

citeinfo.title: Evaluating the Effectiveness of Wildlife Detection and Observation Technologies at a Solar Power Tower Facility

descript.abstract:
These data consist of several discrete data resources captured at the Ivanpah Solar Electric Generating System (ISEGS) during 2014.
The data include 1) Thermal (infrared) data recordings 2) Tabular data representing insect (invertebrate) measurements. 3) Video files 4) Radar data
descript.purpose: These data were collected in support of a project to evaluate the effectiveness of different remote sensing technologies for detecting and observing flying animals at a solar power tower facility.

theme.themekt: Alexandria Digital Library Feature Type Thesaurus

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata and associated scientific publication thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
idinfo.datacred: US Fish and Wildlife Service personnel, Ivanpah Solar Electric Generating System personnel

attracc.attraccr: Use of radar for biological applications is well established to provide high range location accuracy, usually to within a few meters depending on the pulse width and method of AD conversion. Data represent ranging information from a marine-grade portable radar

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.
dataqual.complete: These data are limited in spatial extent to a geographic area within 1.5 km radius of radar locations on Ivanpah Solar Electric Generating System grounds and sample an airspace between 22 m to 273 m above radar level.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal accuracy of bioscatter locations are largely determined by accuracy in range and azimuth. In principle, two flying animals may be distinguishable in range at the pulse width of this radar (0.07 us) if they are separated by >10.5 m. The density aloft of vertebrates and large insects is usually far below this.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

procstep.procdesc: Development of the data set by the agency / individuals identified in the 'Originator' element in the Identification Info section of the record.
